TEI.2.document_title: S Rhoades Fisher to Stephen F Austin, 06-02-1830

barker_notes.barker_summary: S. Rhoads Fisher to Austin, New Orleans, June 2, 1830. Asks Austin's advice about moving his family to Texas in the face of Mexico's apparent change of policy.

*div1 type="summary"* *p*S. Rhoads Fisher to Austin, New Orleans, June 2, 1830. Asks Austin's advice about moving his family to Texas in the face of Mexico's apparent change of policy.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Duplicate Orig: per Hetta*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="06-02-1830">June 2nd 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Colonel Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*My Dear Sir, The object of the present communication being one of considerable Interest to me, I have to beg you will address me by the first opportunity, freely and candidly in relation to the political aspect of the affairs of your *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*— My Stand is taken, and the moment you say my services are required I obey the summons, but unless you can as a *person_mentioned*friend */person_mentioned*advise me to bring my *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*the ensuing *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1830">fall*/date_mentioned*, I shall decide upon leaving them in this *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*— of course I shall be undecided how to act until I hear from you— From the observations in the public prints, I must suppose that the Government are no longer willing to pursue the same course of liberal conduct towards the *location_mentioned*Colonies */location_mentioned*they have heretofore, and therefore as a *person_mentioned*colonist */person_mentioned*I wish to know the attitude we will assume with sentiments of the highest respect and sincere regard I remain your friend and obedient servant*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. Rhoads Fisher*/person_mentioned*-*/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="06-13-1830">June 13th: 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*My Dear Sir,*/p*
*p*The foregoing you will perceive is duplicate, and as I shall leave here in a day or two, on my way to my family in *location_mentioned*Northumberland, Penna*/location_mentioned*: I cannot refrain from again saying I am an "*person_mentioned*Austinian*/person_mentioned*," and urging you to write me whatever may Interest us to know- By a notice in one of the *location_mentioned*late papers */location_mentioned*I perceive *person_mentioned*Colonel Fisher the collector for the *location_mentioned*port of Galveston*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* requires vessels to furnish him with their *location_mentioned*manifests */location_mentioned*at the *location_mentioned*mouth of the Brasos*/location_mentioned*, as this will subject me to delay on my voyage *location_mentioned*from Philadelphia to Matagorda*/location_mentioned*, I should feel indebted to you to ask *person_mentioned*Colonel Fisher*/person_mentioned* if I cannot go direct to *location_mentioned*Matagorda*/location_mentioned*, and forward him the *location_mentioned*Manifest */location_mentioned*to such point as he may direct—*/p*
*p*Remember Colonel on you I depend for the successful result of my petition, and hope soon to hear from you on the subject, as also upon any commercial changes the Government may see proper to make—*/p*
*p*Lest you may not receive the paper, I copy the following paragraph from *location_mentioned*the Argus*/location_mentioned* of *date_mentioned n="06-11-1830">11th: Inst*/date_mentioned*:—*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*—The *location_mentioned*National Gazette*/location_mentioned* publishes extracts from an official paper submitted to the*person_mentioned* Mexican Congress*/person_mentioned* in secret session, by the *person_mentioned*secretary of state,*/person_mentioned* the tenor of which is extremely hostile to the *person_mentioned*American settlers in *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
